page.title: 19West Ashby Henge.
page.content: One km. SE of the Bronze Age barrow lies a Henge monument, normally defined as a circular area enclosed by a bank with an external ditch broken by one or more entrances. It is a class II henge-sited close to water, having two entrances and being more oval than circular. It lies 150m. east of the Bain on the edge of the flood plainon glacial sands and gravels, at a height of 40 O.D.It is about 25m. in diameter with 2 opposite entrances. The aerial photograph shows no sign of a bank, but the ditch is encircled by a series of pits, at least 24, which may have accomodated wooden posts or perhaps upright stones. There are no visible remains on the ground as the monument is ploughed out. There are less than 100 known henges in the country & it is the one unequivocal identification in Lincs. to date.
